head.title: PROFIT UP AT TARGET OF CEMENT TAKEOVER

hedline.hl1: PROFIT UP AT TARGET OF CEMENT TAKEOVER

abstract.p: Blue Circle PLC reports 14 percent rise in profits for first half of year, to 125.8 million pounds, or about $179 million (S)

block.p: A leading building materials manufacturer, Blue Circle P.L.C. of Britain, reported a 14 percent rise in profits for the first half of the year, to $:125.8 million, or about $179 million, helped by cost- cutting and a recovery in Asia. But the results were hurt by the company's extensive spending to thwart a hostile takeover by a French rival, Lafarge S.A. Blue Circle's chief executive, Rick Haythornthwaite, had persuaded investors to reject Lafarge's takeover offer in May, telling them that Blue Circle, which makes about half the cement used in Britain, was better off independent.
